Home » Groups » Alcoholic August

Vegas (Estan Muertas), Baby!!!

  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.
  • The file could not be created.
  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.
  • The file could not be created.
  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.
  • The file could not be created.
Sun, 08/10/2008 - 11:01 | by Jesse

We got to Las Vegas at about 6 or 7PM on Wednesday night. After our only buffet dinner, we decided to sit down at the roulette table and lose a chunk of money. During Charles' 4 hour session (on only $60!) he managed to befriend a couple and the husband came out with us for some drinking. It's not like we could've said no though, because his wife's face was kind of cut up, and we didn't want him to kick our asses too.

We hung out at Pour 24 in the New York, New York (which would eventually become our late night drinking hole.) Our buddy from roulette was nice enough to buy Charles and I a round of French Kamikazes. While they weren't delicious enough to order again, they were apparently potent enough to cause our new friend to pass out at the bar. The bartender wasn't terribly pleased with us, but when she realized we didn't really know the guy, I think she saw the humor in the situation (because none of us were even putting out!) I also had a very strong pale ale at that bar, but I couldn't see what was on the tap. I'm pretty sure it was new though.

Thursday afternoon was a day for giant margaritas. We got those ridiculous yard glass cups, and the bartender loaded it up with seriously about a pint of liquor. I had never had a pint of liquor in one drink before - new drink! We hung out at the pool at the Paris and I managed to finagle myself a float and hung out in the middle of the pool for a while to try to sober up. On the walk back, we purchased some cigars and then had delicious Indian food for dinner. Oh, and another brand new beer - Taj Mahal. It was nothing to write home about - but the food was probably the best Indian food I've had since moving out to the West Coast. Of course, that could've been the margarita talking.

Friday was going to be my day of rest and gambling so that I'd be able to wake up early and help Charles drive home the next morning. That plan slowly went down hill when I left our room to go gamble, but decided to get a beer at the bar. A 22 oz. Sam Adams was like $2.30. Needless to say, I got really excited and called up my friends to come join me. What began as a relaxing beer turned into shots, and ended with Hennessy (new drink!)

Apparently this wasn't satisfying enough, so we ventured out to Big Al's Oyster Bar at the Orleans hotel, and ZOMFG was it worth it. I had never had oyster shooters, before. I hate vodka, and I'm also not really a big fan of oysters themselves, but it seemed like a good idea to order an oyster shooter sampler. In retrospect, it makes me gag just thinking about the oyster floating around in the liquor, but at that moment in time, it was the most delicious thing to ever hit my lips. When paired with an incredible $8.88 seafood deal (because it was August 8th, 2008) I could die a happy man. At the time, the seafood place was better than the Indian restaurant.

I'm pretty sure I put on at least 5 pounds on the trip, but it was worth it. A lot more happened on the trip, but that's for a different blog.

Tags:
  • beer
  • liquor
  • review
  • travel
